title.narrative: APOYO AL PROGRAMA NACIONAL DE REFORMA ADMINISTRATIVA

description.narrative: El proyecto tiende, reforzar las capacidades existentes para una reorganización de la Administración Publica aumentando su eficacia, la transparencia y ética en las diferentes instituciones y departamentos oficiales
El proyecto tiende reforzar las capacidades existentes para una reorganización y modernización de la Administración Publica

description.narrative: 4185 STRENGTHENING THE NATIONAL SYSTEM OF PROTECTED AREAS IN EQUATORIAL GUINEA FOR THE EFFECTIVE CONSERVATION OF REPRESENTATIVE ECOSYSTEMS AND GLOBALLY SIGNIFICANT BIODIVERSITY
independent political entity

Marco Político y Estratégico para el manejo de las Áreas Protegidas desarrollado.

comment.narrative: No existe Plan de Gestión de las Áreas Protegidas.

to desing a Diseñado AWP FOR year 2016 To design Conceptual model for SPAN to condcut METT.Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool (METT). ito conduct PABAT in protected areas To conduct Evaluacion ambiental estrategica To stablish a gender maestriming and intercultural policy in programs and projects to stablish technical steering comite to apply 2 Reserves of Biosphere one in Island and second in continent

Baseline elaborated trought METT and PABAT. Gender and intercultural startegic plan conducted and approved CONCEPTUAL MODEL WAS IN PLACE AND APPROVED BY MINISTRY INTERMINISTERIAL WORKING GROUP WAS ESTABLISHED AND START HIS JOB MANAGEMENTS PLANS WAS REVISED AND CARTOGRAPHIED. MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR SCIENTIFIC RESERVE GRAN CALDERA DE LUBA AND PICO BASILE NATIONAL PARK IS IN PLACE NEW ZONIFICATION FOR PROTECTED AREAS WAS DONE. STEERING COMMITE FOR RESERVES OF BIOSPHERE WAS CONSTITUTED AND START WORKING WITH TOW PROPOSALS:"RESERVA DE LA BIOSFERA ISLA DE BIOKO" Y "RESERVA DE LA BIOSFERA REGION CONTINENTAL".

description.narrative: A Policy framework and Strategy for the management of PAs is developed
Number of revised policies and laws enacted/adopted

comment.narrative:
EG National Biodiversity Policy framework is non-functional.
Environmental sector laws are unclear and contradictory.
No environmental sector coordinating body exists.
EGâ€™s 20-year national development plan is not carbon neutral.

By 2011 a revised National Biodiversity Policy enacted that supports a role for NGOs and community organizations in biodiversity management
By 2012 a new environmental sector law clearly defines complementary roles and responsibilities for MdePyMA, MdeAyB, and INDEFOR
By 2011 an environmental sector coordinating body created, staffed, and budgeted.
By 2012 EGâ€™s 20-year national development plan revised to be carbon neutral.

The project team reviewed all laws relating to environmental, forestry and protected areas.
The project team, has carried out a study and has given the necessary recommendations to address the problem of scattered and contradictory legislation.
the document produced by the project team has been high at the level of the Council of Ministers for its consideration, in the month of June 2015

description.narrative: Change in amount of FONAMA and FONADEFO financial disbursements

comment.narrative: FONAMA and FONADEFO are non-functional.
By 2012 FONAMA and FONADEFO are dispersing 50% of recurrent and operational costs of NSPA and biodiversity management including grants to Guinean conservation NGOs.
At this point, you are waiting for decisions at the level of the Government of the Republic of Equatorial Guinea referred to in the recommendations drawn up by the management of the project team

Since October (incorporation of the CTS) 2014 to date, have been held 6 seminars for training and capacity-building of technicians, Rangers, ecoguardas and volunteers.
More than 65 people have improved their capacities for management, guardianship and custody of protected areas. Both of which are target of the project(4) and the rest of protected areas(9) of Equatorial Guinea.
Is relevant the Symposium about the future of protected areas from the island of Bioko, held on 11 and 12 June, in which more than 90 people: politicians, municipal, regional officials as well as members of civil society received information on actions to follow the project: elaboration of natural resource management plans; elaboration of plans of management and use of the two protected areas of the island of Bioko.

description.narrative: Existence of ecotourism business plan

comment.narrative: No organized, profitable ecotourism exists based on Bioko Island\\\'s rare and endangered primates and birds
By 2012 a business plan for primate- and bird-focused ecotourism on Bioko exists
in drafting the guiding document for the national strategy for green tourism in Guinea Ecuatorial.En collaboration with the Ministry of tourism and the private sector and civil society agencies

description.narrative: Percent of crop damage that is mitigated

comment.narrative: Crop damage from wild animals is unmanaged and unmitigated
By 2012 a quantitative survey of credible wild crop damage exists and a plan for appropriate mitigation prepared and submitted to the GoEG
No progress

description.narrative: Gazetting of the Bioko Forest Corridor

comment.narrative: The critical ecological transect between the Caldera de Luba and Pico BasilÃ©, and the wild animals moving between the two, are unprotected, unmanaged, and vulnerable to forest conversion
By 2012 the Bioko Forest Corridor is gazetted

Processing document to create the reserve of the biosphere of island of Bioko, which contemplates the creation of the Corredor.En paper on legislative recommendations included: - Marine Areas - BiokoCorredor of Monte alen-estuary of Muni broker

description.narrative: Existence of MdePyMA field management unit for the Bioko Forest Corridor

comment.narrative: No management authority has an effective presence on Bioko Island
By 2012 MdePyMA has established a 5-person field management unit assigned to the Bioko Forest Corridor
In progress
